course.subject: FINA
course.name: Intermediate Corporate Finance
course.description: The course provides an in-depth treatment of long-term financing decisions, including estimation of the cost of capital, financial leverage, corporate distress, raising financing, dividend policy, and working capital analysis.
course.prerequisites: FINA 2203 OR FINA 2303

reviews.author: 科大男神
reviews.title: Interesting Instructor, DISASTROUS GRADING
reviews.comment_content:
Intermediate Corporate Finance I would say, much more difficult than 2303.
CAPM, Valuation, Corporate Capital Structure, Payout Policy, WACC, Agency Problem, etc. A lot of quantitative concepts involved.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor English.
He makes jokes and only the nds laugh cause nobody understands his words...
Uses a lot of advanced maths concept (at least to me who have very basic calculus knowledge) to explain the content, very hard to follow.
reviews.comment_grading:
I see one comment which claims that half of the class gets A range. That's bulls**t. I know a lot of students get a D cause it is ABSOLUTE GRADING. Even a Qfin student has a C!!!
Mid term is fine, but counts for only 20%.
Final is a disaster
- though I could eventually understand all the assignments and notes, I know only 20% of the paper.
- One of the 4 questions is essay type. We need to read 4 ESSAYS that each is of 40-50 pages. That's crazy!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
It is fine.
4 assignments, very challenging, but in Qfin's source we trust, you know.
Need to take Attendance, but it's easy to ask for your friend's help cause it's not that strict.

reviews.author: 清水灣廢青
reviews.title: Useful content. Good teaching in class. Very unreasonable grading. Poor teaching off class.
reviews.comment_content: Content is highly relevant to real world setting, focus lots on valuation (not too complex).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frankly speaking, quite fun and interactive, despite very poor handwriting for his notes.
With lots of real world examples.

Just very disappointing to his grading, excuses, being not transparent and irresponsible
reviews.comment_grading:
HW, parti marks undisclosed (unless you ask specifically)

Mid term (20%): 19.4/20
Final Project (50%): 38/40, I spent nearly a whole week for this and have done very very well.
Done HW (20%) seriously and every one should be full.
Final grade: B+

Guess what? I got 2.5/10 in participation (10%). I did attend all classes. TBH, I seldom talked. But isn't too ridiculous to give 2.5 marks for a student attending all classes.

The participation mark distribution is very wide, while variance of other areas like MT & final are very narrow, resulting the final grade highly sensitive to your participation. ON lun 9. Then what's the purpose of the weighting. This 10% participation eventually contributes like 70+% of the grade, at least true in my case.

Given my hard work and grade not reflecting my efforts and performance, I appealed at least 4 times base on the "appeal process", from lecturer, to program coordinator, to SBM, to the dean office. But they insist the grade is reasonable. HKUST appealing system and professors really damn sucks and never unwilling to listen to students' advice. What a bunch of pity mother fuckers.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is fine for those who had some experience before, like me.
But I think for those first time touch this topic, the workload should be pretty heavy, especially the project (need excel skills for modelling, extensive corp fin knowledge).

reviews.author: B.T.
reviews.title: Knowledgable Professor. Extremely relevant content for IBD (Investment Banking Division).
reviews.comment_content:
Comprehensive contents on Corporate Finance.

Topics covered before midterm are more on valuation techniques:
(Cash Flows)
-Capital Budgeting (Review of FINA2303)
-Discounted Cash Flows (Review of FINA2303, added more details on growth assumptions)
(Discount Rate)
-Cost of Equity (Review of FINA3103, CAPM Beta)
-Levered and unlevered Beta
-Cost of Debt, Credit Spreads
(Valuation)
-Terminal Value
-Industry Comparables and Project Comparables
-Exit Multiples
-Weighted Average Cost of Capital
(Analysis)
-Trade-off Theory
-Capital Structure

*** Midterm ***
Slowly shifting from capital structures to transactions after midterm:
(Public Debt)
-Bond Issuance
(Private Debt)
-Trade Finance
(Public Equity)
-Equtiy Issuance, i.e. IPO
-Special Purpose Acquisitons Companies (SPACs)
-Seasonal Equity Offerings (SEO)
-Rights Offerings
(Private Equity)
-Private Equity
-Venture Capitals
(M&A)
-Mergers and Acquisitions
-Leveraged Buyouts
(Dividends)
-Payout Policy

*** Project Present and Final Exam ***

P.S. You will get some few-pages case studies from time to time. Read it to ace your participation in class. The online quizzes for cases are rather easy.

Fruitful and complete contents, particularly useful if you plan to do Corporate Finance, Global Banking or PE firms. Going through all the course materials is a must and you must think the relations between slides deeply to digest everything. Once you understand the concept, this course is not that tough.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very knowledgeable in this area. Theoretically, he derives equations from the basics to show us the facts on the financial ground. On the practical front, he used a couple of real-life cases to show whether an IPO / merger is a success, why a company needs to engage in such corporate event but not others, how to work on valuation multiples, etc.

His teaching maybe a little bit fast, especially on the theory part, where he expects you to have solid and fresh memory of FINA2303 and FINA3103 knowledge. While he starts from the basics, he will go through your "past" courses only in the first 2-3 weeks, with minor additions of the new materials. I would advise not skipping the first few classes because the learning curve will be steeper than you have expected.

He got an accent, somewhere from the Europe I guess, but it's fine. Tha TA Kennedy looks kam, but he is indeed very nice and will answer questions related to exam materials and logistics in detail and promptly.

Some said the professor teaches too fast, which I agree but do not think it is a problem. Students taking this course are at least Year3/4 Fina major, who should have the competency to digest the course materials in the delivered pace. It takes me about three hours at weekend to review and preview, but in general I do not think the pace is a problem and I appreciate how the professor could compress the entire Investment Banking Division into one single semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Midterm
50% Final Exam
20% Group Project
10% Participation
for face-to-face semesters

(Tips)
1. Make sure to answer or ask questions in the lesson (or after class) starting from the first few classes so the professor can recognise your name. Particpation matters quite much.

2. Do all the past paper released by the Professor. The format of Midterm and Final are pretty much the same as the samples. Midterm is like FINA2303 level but the final is quite tough. Questions in final are like brain-teasers. However, most of the question formats are very similar to the samples, so going over them are essential to get good grades in the Final Exam.

Grade:
Midterm: 92.5/100 (Mean around 80)
Final: Not disclosed, I think I did well
Project: Not disclosed, I think I did ok
Attendance: I answered question almost every class

Final Grade: A+

The grading scheme is reasonable for a physical semester since there are midterm and final exams, which works fine differentiating students. Participation is still important.

One downside is that the grades were not transparent. However, I guess if someone feels unsatisfied it is possible to send an email to ask. Apart from that, I think the overall grading was quite lenient.
reviews.comment_workload:
A bit of the workload towards the end of the semester due to the project. You will form a 4-ppl group and basically select a division in the IBD then pretend as an analyst by choosing a client to work on a transaction. Usually, students pick IPO (our group too, coz easiest and more stuff to say) of a company and see if overvalued/undervalued. You will have to use Refinitiv (or other means e.g. if you have a Bloomberg account in your intern office) to extract financial reports, then make proper assumptions, then different methods to valuate the company and give analyses at the end.

This project itself is tedious but also interesting if you like working as a banker. You will then write up a report and present it in 7-8 mins which shouldn't be difficult.

Other workloads include reading cases once per two/three weeks and midterm and final. Not too bad.

reviews.author: ustisfun
reviews.title: Awful teaching, everyone's confused
reviews.comment_content: Content is super fun, you get a full exposure from equity, debt, all the way to how PEVC and M&A works in real life situations. This would be one of those courses where you get the most out of it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nice guy, but extremely poor teaching. Numerical examples are very confusing without any further explanations, handwriting on the whiteboard does not help given his curly and rushed writings. He always seems excited tho mans keep walking back and forth in the classroom
reviews.comment_grading: TBC
reviews.comment_workload: Okay la, midterm, final, and a group project to discuss a real life finance case. Mediocre workload as a FINA course.

reviews.author: gaichung
reviews.comment_content:
Copy 樓下 ：
Corporate Valuation.
M&A, debt, IPO..
- Capital Budgeting CAPM
- Equity Valuation: DCF, Relative Valuation
- Capital Structure: Basics Caesars Capital,WACC
- Debt Valuation
- Public Debt Capital: Bond Markets, Banks, Trade Credit, Cash
- Public Equity Capital: IPOs , SEOs and Rights Offers, VCs, PEs
相當多real life example，應該因為Professor 想訓練我地對Fina既常識
無太多複雜既計算，了解概念比較緊要
reviews.comment_teaching:
條友上一次堂就好似跑一次馬拉松咁係班房內不斷移動
上堂既Flow去得好快，可以拍得上佢既步伐
所以要比較留心，如果唔係就唔知去左邊
上堂會做好多例題示範
reviews.comment_grading:
佢話會比盡A range
mean 同 SD 都無出到
reviews.comment_workload:
有mid-term, project and final
mid-term程度同sample 差唔多
Project 就係去分析一個deal，相當易
Final 同sample完全唔係同一個層次，分題由(a) 出到 (o)

reviews.author: holam
reviews.title: FINA 3303
reviews.comment_content: I do not really understand what is course is happening. In class, there is a lot of discussions. I got no idea of what the professor is saying. Maybe I am too stupid and cannot understand.
reviews.comment_teaching: No comment. Probably I am not clever enough to understand.
reviews.comment_grading:
Since there is no exchange this semester, there is (1) no international students come in for us (2) no exchange out --> all QFIN students are here

Secret grading. NO marks are given except for the midterm. The mean is very high.
Please look at the syllabus for the requirement of each item.

Individual project(40%): only 10 pages report, I think one day or two days can finish it   

There is a requirement for us to do the presentation(<3 mins, a few pages of ppt) and Q&A

Individual Project peer review(10%): review one of the classmate's project and give one-page comment. It only takes 1 hour to do it.

Midterm(20%): Relative valuation and DCF again. For me, it is quite difficult   (mean: 17.7, high 20, me: 17.6)

No in class quiz due to online semester. Case write up appears instead.
2 Case write up (10%*2): two cases. Answer 5-7 questions for each case. My write-up is quite short (maybe the reason why I get a bad grade?) and you can expect to finish one write-up in 2-3 hours.

Class participation(10%): I skipped half of the classes. But if I attend, I will do the participation, but I 9up only.
There is also slack for participation, just copy from the internet and write a few words about the news.

Final letter grade: B+ (probably a good grade already for a FINA course with midterm below mean, and I don't really understand the course content)

I just send an email to prof for breakdown:
i got report 35/40, and all other items in excellent (10/10)
(my friend Midterm 17.3 + report 29 --> B-)

I am quite sure the prof and the TA do not really mark the case write up seriously and simply give all people full mark.
Only midterm and project determine your grade
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light. Only 2 homework. No final. Theoretically, no attendance required if you post frequently on slack.

reviews.author: MC
reviews.comment_content:
睇syllabus la

reviews.comment_teaching:

佢講嘢好快
有時快到聽唔切

要上堂拎hard copy

每一張write up 計一分parti

reviews.comment_grading:
class parti 10%
midterm 20%

reviews.author: Louis925
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting and useful content
Pre MT: wacc, discounted cash flow valuation, relative valuation
Post MT: information asymmetry, Initial public offering, seasoned equity offering, leveraged buyout, venture capital, merger & acquisition, payout policy

He provided lecture videos on canvas and no attendance was taken. The TA released the grades one week after the midterm, which is quick.

Questions in the midterm are similar to the practice questions so it is quite easy. However, the final exam is much more difficult and the questions are different from the practice questions he provided.
reviews.comment_teaching: very good teaching
reviews.comment_grading: Nice grade
reviews.comment_workload: very low workload, no attendance requirement, no hw

CAPM/Valuation/Corporate governance

Given that FINA3303 grading:
A+,A,A-
B+,B
B-,C+

The workload in FINA3303 is a little bit heavy.

reviews.author: Bernice
reviews.title: Good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Corporate Valuation.
M&A, debt, IPO..
- Capital Budgeting CAPM
- Equity Valuation: DCF, Relative Valuation
- Capital Structure: Basics Caesars Capital,WACC
- Debt Valuation
- Public Debt Capital: Bond Markets, Banks, Trade Credit, Cash
- Public Equity Capital: IPOs , SEOs and Rights Offers, VCs, PEs
reviews.comment_teaching:
The speaking speed is fast. Need to pay more attention to follow the teaching flow.

Hard copy will only be provided in the lesson.
Some of the teaching material may not be uploaded to canvas. So, please attend classes.

Professor will first review some basic valuation tools. Exercises will be give for revision. After that, he will mainly focus on daily cases to explain the concept and the valuation tools will be used to analyse as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Professor will give the maximum number of A range to the students. Therefore, the grading is quite good and satisfied.

class parti 10%
midterm 20%
project report 10%
project present 10%
final exam 50%
reviews.comment_workload:
Every 2 weeks will have a case for us to analyse and have a small write-up part for each case.
1 group project.
1 mid term with no average announce. He will tell you that everyone is better than the average.
1 final exam.

reviews.author: Hi_everyone
reviews.title: Poor teaching and content
reviews.comment_content:
Before the midterm, the content is similar to FINA2303. Covering NPV, CAPM, cost of equity, cost of debt, WACC, basically a recap of content taught in FINA2303.

After the midterm, the content is very abstract. Covering information asymmetry, IPO, SEO, private equity, private debt, M&A and payout policy.

I give a C here for the content because I have zero interest in corporate finance or IBD related jobs, however students who are interested in the above  may find the content quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Alminas's teaching is disastrous. He is passionate in teaching, but I have to say that his speech lacked organization. During the lesson, he will jump here and there (physically), while the content on the slide and his speech will also jump here and there.

It is really hard to have many take-aways by attending his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very good.

I score 10 marks above median in midterm. The midterm exam is relative easy, with median of around 76.
For the final exam, the score is not disclosed, but I think I do not perform very well. The final exam is very lengthy and difficult, and is more like a maths exam rather than a finance exam.

Turns out the letter grade is A.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low.

A midterm exam (20%) and final exam (50%), group project on any deals (20%), and class participation (10%).

reviews.author: imoj
reviews.title: if you like math & self study
reviews.comment_content:
As the previous comments mentioned
Well I actually find the slides pretty clear, I have 6 hr classes the day having this course and almost haft asleep but still, if you spend time after class on the notes, it's pretty clear and intuitive
I don't think it is a difficult overall.
reviews.comment_teaching: Many said the prof's English is not comprehensible and it's quite true actually. Even so, I think he's a quite funny professor if you get his examples, if you do, it feels like open a new dimension, if you don't, well it sees no connections between those stories & finance at all...(cuz I don't understand sometimes too....
reviews.comment_grading:
tbh I think it's of very good grading..... maybe one of the best grading courses among finance I guess? Because it's of absolute grading!
I get full mark in midterm (midterm is easy, calculation intuitive too) Homework is like, everyone get an A+ (I think there is no differentiation in HW at all)
I eventually got an A (actually it is said there were 15 A+ last year... I got full mark in hw&mt, so must have screwed up in final I guess, but the mark wasn't released.
Anyway, it's a course that you don't need to spare too much efforts to get an A/A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light
You have only 4 assignments in the semester and you can discuss with your friends so not a big deal. But in the beginning of the semester we all feel the course is quite hard (mostly because the first assignment require a lot of calculations

reviews.author: Candacegu
reviews.comment_content: the basic theory of valuation. the whole class is talking about how to evaluate the fair price. the main idea is about no-arbitrage.
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructor highlights the logic, he used many interesting stories to let us understand why this is true and how the theory comes.
reviews.comment_grading: absolute grading, the instructor says he gives A range for an overall grade above 80. I guess over half students get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: not much. this course takes attendance. as long as you take the class and take notes, there's nothing difficult.

reviews.author: Anson_cth
reviews.comment_content:
Same as others' reviews
But no guest lecture in this semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A nice professor.
His accent is easy to understanding but he speaks a little bit fast.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.
The TA will not release the final exam score and project score.
No-one knows how the TA count the participation scores.
50% - Final exam
20% - Mid term exam
20% - Group project
10% - Attendance/ Participation
reviews.comment_workload: No homework but the group project really costed lots of time. The project includes valuation and analyzing. Students have to present to our students by the end of the semester.

reviews.author: notverysmart
reviews.title: Excellent course content
reviews.comment_content: Lots of discussions in class. Everything he teaches in class is useful. You will understand 80% of things you read in financial times after taking this course. Literally an eye opener.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is great. He explains everything clearly and his English is perfect. However, I know some peers lose track of the course and didn't understand anything from then on. Since there is no final, I think students stopped paying attention after the mid term. However, the course content is very interesting and useful, so I think paying attention is still worth it even after the mid term.
reviews.comment_grading:
I cannot really speak for everyone because grading is not transparent. Personally, I think the grading is great. I think everything comes down to in-class participation and the effort you spent on the final report.

See holam's post for specific grading critera.

Tips:

1) Make sure he knows you. Provide meaningful participations in class. Join the discussion, answer questions, ask questions. I think reading the news and having a basic understanding of the world of finance will help you in getting participation points.  Post meaningful slack threads once in a while (I posted 1-3 times and spent about 1-2 hours making each post).

2) Pick a final project that is complex and difficult. I cannot stress enough that you need to familiarize yourself with your topic before finalizing your choice for the final project. Find a project that has MANY CORPORATE GOVERNANCE ISSUES.
reviews.comment_workload:
Low workload. No final, only project. I swear to god you wont find a finance course with workload this low in your life. He wanted to give us in class quiz after the mid term but decided not to (which is good because in class quizzes are very stressful). Mid term is an unsupervised 3 hour valuation case study.

I believe next semester the midterm format would be different. Last year it was a 2 hour exam.

reviews.author: rubbishstudent
reviews.title: a lot of self study
reviews.comment_content:
I personally not that interested in the topics but I guess they are really the basic of corporate finance
topics include:
CAPM
Arbitrage
Corporate valuation
management-shareholders-debtholders conflict
reviews.comment_teaching:
Everyone says that prof's english is hard to understand, I actually agree. But try to pay some effort in listening what he said coz his explanation is actually clear in terms of the content. He also try to use some example and draw graphs in illustrating his idea
Make sure you have to follow what he said every lesson cause once you are lost, you are lost forever
try not to copy every single word that he wrote coz it is actually inside the notes
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.
Midterm (20%)
Final (60%)
4 Assignment (15%)
Participation (5%)
The midterm is easy for everyone except me... coz I do not really understand the topics taught and there is not much exercise given in class
The final is even harder but the mark is not release
Mean for midterm: 82.4/100 (I got 85)
got A+ for all assignment
Full attendance
got an A at the end
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much to do in the term but only the assignment
few questions for each assignment and cost you an hour to finish it

reviews.author: lmacchch
reviews.title: 好课好龟，对投行面试好有用，但上课比较痛苦
reviews.comment_content:
如果你没什么实践经验，你会觉得他讲的是shit，但是当我参加corporate finance/ib/M&A 面试的时候，我才发现教授讲的是真的有用

example：我面试的时候被问net working capital是怎么计算出来的，我说 NWC=AR+IN-AP，然后面试官追问在balance sheet里面如果涉及其他item应该怎样调整。我说如果是operational相关的，就放进去，financial相关的就不算，面试官表示答得漂亮。

我觉得这种很detail的tech是很难学到的，但是教授也有在课上讲，除此之外他讲的很多concept和很多case如果能在面试的时候讲出来的话，绝对是impressive，big plus，可以make you stand out

真心推荐这门课，希望大家好好学
reviews.comment_teaching: 讲课好有激情，他讲的好激动，但是hard to follow。但是他讲的不错，我建议大家try your best to follow，因为他讲的对入ib真的有用
reviews.comment_grading:
龟一定是烂龟的，因为很卷，但我个人觉得这门课worth a bad grade，因为真的有学到野

他期末题出的很难，但出的漂亮，期中是financial modeling, which can really enhance your understanding to financial modeling. 期末是4个大case，用这种case来解释他上课讲的很多concept，比如agency problem，information asymmetry，controling premium。总体来说试卷质量很高，但唯一的缺陷是平时练习不足，final给的past paper跟这次考试又差很多，做起来让人头大

出龟后edit：比我想象的好太多了，我A+，应该是final考的比较好 毕竟我知道我group project和peer evaluation得分不高
reviews.comment_workload:
超细workload
只用读读case，做个简单的project就ok
